sentence.idiomatic: We should conquer our fears.
This house is very scary.
He has a phobia.
Getting hurt is hard to avoid.
When you are learning it's impossible to avoid encountering various difficulties.
It's difficult for people to avoid making mistakes.
We must overcome all difficulties.
If you want to find a job in China, you had better overcome the language barrier.
You need to learn how to overcome difficulties.
This child is not at all afraid of strangers.
I am afraid of the dark.
Are you afraid of heights?
She is good at making the best of a small space.
It is not comfortable to live in such a cramped space.
Many Shanghainese people have very cramped houses.
The smell of cigarettes in this room is suffocating.
The air here is stifling.
I'm going to suffocate.
Let’s go swimming this weekend!
I can’t swim. To tell the truth, I’m a little bit afraid of the water.
What? You’re this old, and scared of the water?
Don’t laugh at me. I really have a phobia of water. Everyone has a fear of something. You must be afraid of something too.
I certainly am. I have acrophobia. When I look down from high places, I instantly get dizzy, and my legs start to shake.

Yes, it seems that these kinds of things are natural. Even as we get older, there’s no way to overcome them. For example, a lot of people have a fear of flying. It’s so serious that they can’t even travel by plane. It’s very inconvenient.

Yeah, my good friend is like that. There are also lots of people who have claustrophobia. When they are in confined spaces, they feel like they can’t breathe, even to the point that they feel like they are going to suffocate.

word.literal: hair (on the human body and head)

sentence.idiomatic: These are all the more common phobias. I also know some people have a phobia of hair. When they see hair, it’s just as scary to them as seeing a ghost. When they look at their own hair every day, how can they cope?
Yeah. I guess our situations aren’t really that bad.
